Dear all,

I have a humble question regarding the DecidingScope.
Is there c=
urrently any way to *forcibly* accept or reject a URI regardless of 
any do=
wnstream DecideRules?

If I understand correctly, the DecideRuleSequence cl=
ass currently iterates 
over all DecideRules and adjusts the overall decisi=
on to the current 
DecideRule's decision whenever that one is not "PASS". T=
he problem is that 
one really must carefully consider where to put a decid=
e rule.

For example, adding a PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule at the end of t=
he sequence 
will always result in ACCEPT for any prerequisite document, ev=
en if that 
prerequisite's URI has been declared out of scope by upstream d=
ecide rules.

Wouldn't it make sense to offer the administrator some more c=
ontrol over these 
rules by adding something like an ANDDecideRuleSequence =
(returns REJECT as 
soon as it gets a REJECT) and an ORDecideRuleSequence (=
returns ACCEPT as soon 
as it gets an ACCEPT)?

Cheers,
